meanings.sent1: The annihilation of the toy was caused by the playful puppy.
meanings.sent2: The city faced annihilation when the volcano erupted.
meanings.sent3: The cake met its annihilation when the hungry children arrived.
meanings.sent4: The storm brought an annihilation of the fragile sandcastle.
meanings.sent5: The annihilation of the paper by fire left only ashes behind.

meanings.definition: The act of making something non-existent
meanings.sent1: Her magic wand caused the annihilation of the villain in the story.
meanings.sent2: The magician's trick involved the annihilation of the red scarf.
meanings.sent3: The potion promised the annihilation of all bad dreams.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstroke led to the annihilation of the mistake on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment resulted in the annihilation of the theory.

meanings.definition: The state of being completely destroyed or wiped out
meanings.sent1: The annihilation of the sandcastle by the waves saddened the child.
meanings.sent2: The virus caused the annihilation of the entire computer system.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain brought about the annihilation of the outdoor party.
meanings.sent4: The battle led to the annihilation of the enemy forces.
meanings.sent5: The forest fire resulted in the annihilation of the lush greenery.
